meanings.definition: A person who sells or deals in particular goods or commodities.
meanings.sent1: The purveyor at the market had a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables for sale.
meanings.sent2: The local bakery is a popular purveyor of delicious pastries and bread.
meanings.sent3: The purveyor of jokes at the comedy club had the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: She was a purveyor of hope, always bringing positivity to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The purveyor of knowledge shared valuable insights with the students.

meanings.definition: A person or group that spreads or promotes something.
meanings.sent1: As a purveyor of peace, he worked tirelessly to resolve conflicts in the community.
meanings.sent2: The company acted as a purveyor of environmental awareness, promoting sustainable practices.
meanings.sent3: The purveyor of gossip in the office always had the latest news to share.
meanings.sent4: She became a purveyor of joy, spreading happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The purveyor of change inspired others to embrace new ideas and perspectives.
